pullRequest.body:
Initial segments preserve the covering relation, successors, and successor limits.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0b81fc83c5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19053/commits/0b81fc83c5af5f7e9da9d1fb78db85353f63a0e4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Order.SuccPred.InitialSeg`|381|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`++ _`
`++ apply_covBy_apply_iff`
`++ apply_wCovBy_apply_iff`
`++ isMin_apply_iff`
`++ isSuccLimit_apply_iff`
`++ isSuccPrelimit_apply_iff`
`++ map_pred`
`++ map_succ`
`++-- map_isMin`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
</details>

I think the increased imports mainly come from the `OrdConnected` stuff. I don't think this is a huge issue however, since the `InitialSeg` API is mainly meant to be used with `Ordinal` which uses about twice as many imports.

> I think the increased imports mainly come from the `OrdConnected` stuff. I don't think this is a huge issue however, since the `InitialSeg` API is mainly meant to be used with `Ordinal` which uses about twice as many imports.

There are 37 files (most not in the `Ordinal` API) that have their imports increased by 10.
Just moved these results to a new file.
游 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12078854878/job/33683875365)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12078854878/job/33683875709)

Thanks!

bors merge

Thanks! 游

maintainer delegate
Looks like you're increasing imports quite a bit. What files are now imported in `Order.InitialSeg` that were not before?

Thanks! 游

maintainer delegate

Thanks!

bors merge

```suggestion
theorem apply_covBy_apply_iff [PartialOrder 풤] (f : 풤 곣i ) : f a 긨 f a'  a 긨 a' :=
  Set.OrdConnected.apply_covBy_apply_iff sorry
```

There's a one line proof using this and [`IsLowerSet.ordConnected`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/UpperLower/Basic.html#IsLowerSet.ordConnected), but this increases the imports even further.

What should we done? Do we just eat the import increase? Do we make a separate file for the handful of upper set/covering lemmas on initial/principal segments? Do we keep the older and slightly longer proof?
The best would be to rearrange the files so that there's little to no import increase, and the second best would be to create a new file
I don't really know how to do the former. I think I'll just make a `SuccPred/InitialSeg` file to put all of the covering/successor lemmas in.

```suggestion
  (isLowerSet_range f).ordConnected.apply_covBy_apply_iff f.toOrderEmbedding
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/InitialSeg): initial segments preserve successor limits
